text: Start your day by praying Fajr on time and making a short dua for guidance and protection.
Choose one small sunnah (like using the miswak, saying Bismillah before eating) and keep it consistent for a week.
Set a simple Quran goal: even half a page with reflection is better than rushing through many pages.
Keep a small sadaqah box at home; add coins or small amounts regularly, and give it out each month.
Silence a potential argument by reminding yourself that Allah loves those who control their anger.
Send a kind message or make dua for someone you haven’t spoken to in a while, just for Allah’s sake.
Take 1–2 minutes after each prayer to make personal dua in your own language.
Before sleeping, forgive others for the day and ask Allah to forgive you as well.
Choose one day in the week to fast voluntarily if you are able, and use that day for extra dhikr.
Read or listen to one short hadith daily and try to apply it practically in your life.
